course.name: Done is better - Build What Matters

questions.question: A client expects a delivery date you are not sure you can meet. What should you do?
options: Share the constraint or trade-off you have not mentioned; propose how you will handle it together
Promise the date to avoid difficult conversations about constraints
Stay vague and hope the client does not press for specifics
Blame internal factors only without proposing solutions or alternatives

questions.question: A client requests a feature in two weeks. Instead of promising it, the team lead says: "We can do that, but it means delaying Y. Here are three options." What does this demonstrate?
options: Moving from client to partner: sharing constraints and trade-offs, inviting them into the problem
Giving the client everything they ask for without pushback or discussion
Treating the client as the enemy to manage and control
Only sharing deliverables and hiding constraints or trade-offs

questions.question: How do you build trust through transparency with a client?
options: Share one constraint or trade-off you have not mentioned; propose how you will handle it together
Hide problems to maintain a positive relationship and avoid difficult conversations
Overpromise to please the client and deal with problems later
Only report status without sharing constraints, trade-offs, or unknowns

questions.question: Hiding problems to preserve the relationship short-term can lead to:
options: Surprises later and broken trust when the problem surfaces
Stronger relationship
Faster delivery
No meaningful effect on outcomes

questions.question: Treating the client as someone to please rather than to align with tends to:
options: Overpromising and underdelivering; no real partnership
Better satisfaction
Faster decisions
No significant downside in practice

questions.question: What should you share with a client or partner?
options: Constraints, timelines, trade-offs, and unknowns so they can align and help
Only good news to maintain a positive relationship and avoid worry
Only the deliverable without sharing any constraints or challenges
Only when asked directly, otherwise keep information to yourself

questions.question: A client relationship needs more transparency. What is the next step with one client or partner?
options: Share one constraint or trade-off you have not mentioned before; propose how you will handle it together
Wait for them to ask about constraints before sharing anything proactively
Send a generic update without specific constraints or trade-offs or transparency
Schedule more meetings to discuss without actually sharing constraints or unknowns
